title: Barnier government confirms Macron's shift to the right
summary: The team put together by the new prime minister combines Macron loyalists with a dozen elected representatives from the most conservative right. It's a far cry from the social-democratic roots of Emmanuel Macron's early supporters.

title: Duo of Macron loyalists at helm of France's Economy and Finance Ministry will ensure continuity
summary: Thirty-three-year-old Antoine Armand will be in charge of the economy, while 39-year-old Laurent Saint-Martin will try to pass a budget.

title: In Hungary, the hypocrisy of a homophobic priest is exposed
summary: Gergő Bese, an influential priest who relays the government's anti-LGBT propaganda extensively in the media, has been suspended from his duties after it was revealed that he participated in gay sex parties.

title: Israel and Hezbollah urged to step back from the brink
summary: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said after a night of intense rocket fire from Lebanon that Israel has dealt 'a series of blows.' Hezbollah was equally defiant, with the group's deputy chief Naim Qassem saying it was in a 'new phase.'

title: New French Interior Minister embodies the conservative right
summary: The 63-year-old conservative senator's stance on immigration has raised concerns among the left and migrant aid organizations.

title: Paris department stores launch charm offensive
summary: New brands, store exclusives, vintage sections... Galeries Lafayette, Printemps and Le Bon Marché are making changes to lure back French customers.

title: Germany Scholz's Social Democrats narrowly ahead of far-right in Brandenburg regional election
summary: According to final results published Sunday, the Social Democrats won 30.9% of the votes in the election to the parliament of Brandenburg. The far-right Alternative for Germany was a close second with 29.2%.

title: Ukrainian President Zelensky begins US visit with ammunition factory to thank workers
summary: Zelensky will speak at the UN General Assembly annual gathering in New York on Tuesday and Wednesday and then travel to Washington for talks on Thursday with President Joe Biden and Vice President Kamala Harris.

title: In Italy, Robby the cabby is driving for honesty
summary: Bologna cab driver Roberto Mantovani, aka 'Robby,' published a book over the summer denouncing the tax evasion practices of most of his colleagues. This transparency has earned him fame in his home country, but disdain among members of his profession.

title: Dozens of women accuse Mohammed Al-Fayed of having been a sexual predator
summary: The Egyptian businessman, owner of Harrods and the Ritz, died in 2023 at the age of 94. Following the revelations of a series of BBC documentaries, more than 30 women claim to have been sexually assaulted or raped by the man who was then their boss.

title: In the US, several Robinson campaign staffers quit as fallout over disturbing posts continues
summary: Republican North Carolina Republican Lt. Gov. Mark Robinson has a long history of making inflammatory comments. CNN unearthed posts in which he said in 2012 that he preferred Hitler to Obama and that MLK Jr. was 'worse than a maggot.'

title: Britain's far right is hoping to strengthen its national presence
summary: At their annual conference near Birmingham, Nigel Farage's Reform UK party leaders and politicians are counting on the Conservatives' vulnerability and Labour's missteps.

title: Turkey: Young girl's murder highlights authorities' silence on child disappearances
summary: The country has been in turmoil since the discovery of 8-year-old Narin Güran's body in a river. Despite an apparent increase in child attacks, officials have been silent, with no relevant statistics since 2016.

title: Explosion at a coal mine in eastern Iran kills at least 33 workers
summary: Around 70 people had been working at the time of the blast, one of the worst mining disasters in the country's history.

title: Marxist leader to become Sri Lanka's next president
summary: Anura Kumara Dissanayaka, the 55-year-old leader of the People's Liberation Front, was declared the winner of the weekend's election with nearly 1.3 million more votes than his nearest rival.

title: Israeli strike in Beirut decimates command of Hezbollah's Radwan force
summary: Israeli Defense Minister Yoav Gallant called the strike on Ibrahim Akil, the commander of this elite unit, a 'new phase of war.'

title: Understanding how the US presidential election works
summary: Before Tuesday, November 5, when polling stations open, several million Americans will have already cast their votes through mail-in ballots or early voting.

title: French sports clubs struggle to keep up with the Olympic effect
summary: In the wake of the Olympic and Paralympic Games, clubs are in such strong demand that their resources are being stretched to the limit.

title: The Barnier government is a far cry from Macron's promised national unity
summary: The tug-of-war between the presidential camp and the right has led to a government nearly evenly divided between the two sides.

title: Le Monde's selection of fall concerts in Paris
summary: From Pat Metheny to Thomas Adès, Le Monde's culture department offers a selection of classical, jazz and world music events.

title: Jean-Noël Barrot, a newcomer to France's foreign affairs ministry
summary: The promotion of the 41-year-old centrist, previously junior minister in charge of Europe, shows Emmanuel Macron's determination to keep a firm grip on his 'reserved domain.'

title: In Japan, local media report six dead after floods
summary: Heavy rain pounded Ishikawa from Saturday, with more than 540 millimeters (21 inches) recorded in the city of Wajima over 72 hours, the heaviest continuous rain since comparative data became available.

title: Spending deal averts a possible federal shutdown and funds the government until after US elections
summary: Temporary spending bills generally fund agencies at current levels, but an additional $231 million was included to bolster the Secret Service after the two assassination attempts against Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump.

title: In northern France, the massive Verkor battery factory built in record time
summary: In the port of Dunkirk, the gigafactory has been completed and is starting to receive its first equipment.

title: French new PM calls for 'national effort' to cut deficit
summary: In his first televised interview since he became prime minister, Michel Barnier said France's financial situation was 'very serious' but ruled out across-the-board tax rises.

title: Sri Lanka elects a Marxist to lead a country shattered by five years of crisis
summary: The new president, Anura Kumara Dissanayake, embodies political renewal, two years after the citizens' revolution, whose aspirations he claims to carry forward.
